meanings.definition: A small mark or flaw that spoils the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The mirror had a few blemishes on its surface.
meanings.sent2: She used makeup to cover up her blemishes.
meanings.sent3: The blemishes on the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The blemishes on the wall were like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The blemishes on the car were impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: To spoil the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: Rain can quickly blemish a freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally blemished the table with a scratch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat blemished the clean floor with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words blemished their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti blemished the beauty of the historic building.
